statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.name: offensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

article.headline: Binghamton 48, Boston U. 47
article.story: BOSTON (AP) -- Andre Heard scored 17 of his game-high 22 points in the second half as Binghamton won its fourth straight, 48-47 over Boston University on Sunday. Ben Coblyn scored on a dunk with 6.3 seconds remaining to pull the Terriers (5-11, 2-3 America East) within 48-47. Binghamton's Sebastian Hermenier missed a free throw and BU got the rebound with five seconds left. But the Terriers had no timeouts and weren't able to get a shot off before the buzzer. Heard scored seven consecutive points for the Bearcats (7-9, 4-1) midway through the second half to help spark a 9-0 run as Binghamton turned a three-point deficit into a six-point lead. Heard's 3-pointer with 11:35 remaining made it 36-34 and gave the Bearcats the lead for good. Corey Hassan made it 44-40 with a 3-pointer with 5:24 remaining but missed a pair of free throws on Boston University's next possession. Heard extended the Bearcats lead to six the next time down the floor with an off-balance jumper. The Terriers, losers of four straight, scored less than 50 points for the fifth time this season. Shaun Wynn had 13 points, six rebounds and six assists and Hassan added 10 for Boston University. The Bearcats, who beat the Terriers in Boston for the first time, led 25-21 at halftime.
